primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God systematically deconstructs human 'advantage' (privilege/scarcity) through the death and resurrection of Christ to establish a new reality of impartial abundance.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has moved beyond old chosenness.
God raised him up on the third day.

object.identificatie: A level playing field / Kingdom of Abundance
tekstueel_bewijs: The new evangelical possibility is grounded in forgiveness.
The power of Easter does not let the old niceties of chosenness prevail.
The Spirit was poured out even on the Gentiles.
We become free, we males... we whites.
He went about doing good and healing.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Kingdom of Scarcity / Human Hegemony
tekstueel_bewijs: The people who sought to maintain advantage killed him.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is identified as the 'domain of death' and 'the devil,' requiring a divine resurrection to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's transition from fearful anxiety/clinging to privilege to neighborly love and sharing.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (The Advantaged)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a result of the primary program (Easter/Forgiveness).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has moved beyond old chosenness.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have parlayed that chosenness into economic authority.
We must find new neighborly ways.

voorbeelden: Now must find new neighborly ways.
They wanted to be saved the way they always were.
I truly understand that God shows no partiality.
The Spirit is a flood and surge.
Easter has dispelled the truth of scarcity.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the Resurrection and the Spirit which enables a new reality, rather than the 'Obligation' (Devoir) of the hearer.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S1-implication (Chosenness) to ~S1 (Advantage/Idolatry) to S2 (Death/Killing Jesus) and finally to S1 (Resurrection/Abundance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's unilateral act of raising Jesus, which invalidates the logic of scarcity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; scarcity is linked to the 'domain of death' and the crucifixion.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies human effort (clinging to advantage) as the problem and God's unilateral action (Easter/Spirit) as the solution.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: King, Romero, all the daring witnesses.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God raised him up on the third day.
The kingdom of death and scarcity.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Peter are shown as failing or being corrected by God, not as models of virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Peter is a 'Receiver' of a vision, not the 'Subject' of his own enlightenment.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'unending anxiety' of maintaining privilege.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification is an escape from the 'cocoon of denial' into God's abundance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Advantage' of the Old Testament to the 'Impartiality' of the New is structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Chosenness' as a gift and 'Advantage' as a sin.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Easter has dispelled the truth of scarcity.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'Pouvoir' (Power) that enables the new life.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'cocoon of denial' and a 'domain of death' that kills the Messiah.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative, relegating human action to a secondary response to grace.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the hallmark of a grace-oriented sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Savoir' (Knowing) of the new reality doesn't turn into a new Law.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in narrative homiletics that uses a secular metaphor (tennis) to expose deep theological structures without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the McEnroe metaphor's effectiveness, Greimas shows how the metaphor functions as a 'Opponent' to the Gospel's 'Object'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond explaining Acts 10 to showing how the 'actantial engine' of the text is mirrored in modern socio-political structures.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Advantage' is not just a theme but an actantial role that the Subject (God) must defeat.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by showing even the 'heroes' (Peter/Israel) as resistant to God's plan.
